intro: Espeletia humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's espeletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean highlands of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and striking, showy inflorescences. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil. Its flowers typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Espeletia humbertii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to biodiversity and soil stabilization.
